description: R Library for Quantitative Analysis in Archaeology.
Analysis, Seriation and Visualization of Archaeological Count Data.
Tool for Online Seriation and Correspondence Analysis.
R package to help interpreting Correspondence Analysis' results.
R Package for contingency tables seriation via Correspondence Analysis.
R script that implements a means for statistically assessing the degree of co-occurrence between classes within a dataset.
Script for conducting K-means cluster analysis using R. This script provides output designed to help the user select an appropriate cluster solution.

Script for calculating Brainerd-Robinson coefficients based on tabular count or percent data. This script also estimates the probability that a given difference between two samples is the product of sampling error.
Script for calculating mean ceramic dates based on tabular data. This script also estimates sampling error using a bootstrapping procedure.
R-script for conducting and evaluating bootstrapped correspondence analyses.
R Script for Seriation Using Correspondence Analysis.
Moran's I and Getis-Ord G* Analysis.
Pure Locational Clustering.
Unconstrained Clustering.
Working with map data in R.
Point Pattern Analysis.

This R package contains exactly one function, that calculates the "sum of individual weighted means" according to a methodology that is quite common among archaeologists and was first published in 1988 by Elisabeth Fentress and Philip Perkins.

Application (in LibreOffice Calc) for serializing a graphic matrix from counting tables. The application makes it possible to obtain either a serograph or a graph of the PVI matrograph type (visualization of the differences in independence from the percentages of independence values) which does not favor the vision of the variables over that of the lines and more suitable for non-chronological treatments.

A package to analyze data used to determine whether samples from multiple sources can be separated, to predict the sources of samples from unknown sources, and to evaluation the validity of those predictions. Sample data can include both quantitative and qualitative data. The package includes functions for creating an analysis file from multiple files and exploratory data analysis, as well as multivariate statistical methods to determine source separation, predict sources of unknown samples, and evaluate the validity of the predictions (principal components, classification trees, and random forests).
Estimates artifact class diversity in multiple geographic regions.
A QGIS 3 plugin for spatio-temporal interpolation of archaeological settlement evidence.
ArcGIS toolbox for fuzzy viewshed calculation.

Calculates visible surface from a given observer point over a digital elevation model. The plugin is intended for more complex modelling, such as the depth below the visible horizon or generation of intervisibilty networks between groups of points. It is particularly performant for multiple viewshed calculations form a set of fixed points.
A toolbox for modelling human perception of topography for QGIS, based on QGIS viewshed module.
The ArchaeoLines plugin displays any combination of declination arcs most relevant to archaeo- or ethnoastronomical studies.
R Package to reconstruct paths using archaeological monuments, model parameters of infrastructure and evaluate those parameters, model parameters of infrastructure and evaluate those parameters.
GIS toolbox for estimating the duration of ancient sail-powered navigation.

Provides the facility to calculate non-isotropic accumulated cost surface and least-cost paths using a number of human-movement-related cost functions that can be selected by the user. It just requires a Digital Terrain Model, a start location and (optionally) destination locations.
This is an example implementation of chrono-spatial modelling of settlement activities.
Models relationships between elements in a terrain model, connecting pixels according to their height difference.

Provides the functionality to calculate Least Cost Paths (LCPs) which are often, but not exclusively, used in archaeological research. This package can be used to apply multiple cost functions when approximating the difficulty of moving across a landscape, as well as taking into account traversing across slope and other costs such as landscape features. This package also provides functionality to validate the accuracy of the computed LCP relative to another path.
Android apps for archaeology that enable photography during field work.
An app for use in archaeological field survey to collect high-accurate point locations, photographs, and other data.
A QGIS plugin for local site grids.
Plugin for drawing trenches.
Spatial Sampling and Survey Simulation Tools.
A simple gui app to simplify scanning single context plans.
A QGIS plugin to simplfy digitization of archaeological plans drawn using the Museum of London Single Context Recording methodology.
The goal of sitedefinition is to see how feature densities might be used for site definition.
Mobile-oriented browser based application that could be used for data collection.
A tool for creating and manipulating Harris Matrices, part of the Archaeological Recording Kit ARK.
harris2graph is a script to help migrate data from the LST file format used by the BASP Harris, Stratify and ArchEd packages into modern graph file formats.
notes: This seems to stem from prior work done at https://github.com/jlayt/harris2gv

description: Create a Harris Matrix from archaeological stratigraphy data using Python and Graphviz.
Write Graphviz dot files for archaeological sequence diagrams and Bayesian chronological models.
Harris Matrix Visualization for the web using D3 + KLayJS-D3.
Application for creating stratigraphic diagrams and checking the consistency of the chronostratigraphic recording.
Chronological Modelling of Archaeological Data using Bayesian Statistics.
A R package for the aoristic analysis of archaeological data.
Frequency time-series tools for archaeology.
R package for archaeological stratigraphy and chronological sequences.
Bayesian Modeling of Archaeological Chronologies.
Tools for the post-processing of the Markov Chain simulated by any software used for the construction of archeological chronologies.
Post-Processing of the Markov Chain Simulated by 'ChronoModel', 'Oxcal' or 'BCal'.

Applications for obtaining chronograms (quantified chronology diagrams) and time distribution curves of archaeological or historical units from quantified dating indicators treated as inaccuracy intervals.
The EPPM serograph is a graphical tool for chronological serialization of archaeological furniture counting tables.
The zooaRch package provides analytical tools to make inferences on zooarchaeological data.
The zooaRchGUI package provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to analytical tools for zooarchaeological data in the R package.
Analysis of Archaeological Mortality Data.
Crossbones autogenerates 3D schematic skeletons, making rapid surveying and visualisation of dense skeletal assemblages a snap.
some tools in respect to pollen data processing.
Modelling and feature detection in palaeoenvironmental time series using additive models.
Analogue and weighted averaging methods for palaeoecology.
An R package to simulate species occurences and abundances counts, along gradient.
R package for community ecologists: popular ordination methods, ecological null models & diversity analysis.
Dynamic and static 3D plotting for vegan.
ggplot-based plots for vegan.
R package for calculating quantitative ethnobotany indices.
CharTool is a macro tool for quantifying charcoal particles for paleoecological research applications.

TIPOM is based on a methodology that was developed in the 1960s by Bernardino Bagolini. The basic idea is to use the three simple dimensions of length, width and thickness of each lithic artefact to classify them in discrete groups and infer their function.
Calculate the capacity of a ceramic vessel, like an amphora.

sdsbrowser is an R Shiny WebApp developed to make the available SDS datasets (following the Systematic and Digital Documentation of Stone Artefacts recording system) more accessible. It is designed to give you a quick overview on the spatial and temporal scope of sites previously analysed with SDS and the distribution of artefacts within these sites.
dsanalysis is the backbone of the sdsbrowser webapp, and can be employed to analyse SDS stone artefact data in R.
Brings together a range of methods for analysing the time series, shapes and other properties of archaeological artefacts.
.obj slicing for lithic 3d morphometrics.
Digitize archeological drawings of vessels in order to calculate their capacity and weight.
A tool for the geospatial analysis, literary network visualization, and plot mapping of ancient texts.

This is an R package for the extraction, analysis and classification of (not only) archaeological objects derived from scanned images. Especially it aims at the analysis of the shapes/profiles of eg. ceramic vessels or arrow heads.
R code for converting B&W jpgs of artefact silhouettes to matrices and computing basic Elliptical Fourier statistics, including PCA and MANOVA.
R scripts for digitizing, processing, analyzing, and comparing archaeological ceramic 2d profile drawings, photographs, and other data.
Synthetic Categories for Archaeological Vessel Comparison.
This Python library was written as an help for the study of stone walls, mainly through the quantitative analysis of spatial dimensions of stones.
Visual shape-matching of ceramics profiles.
An App to recognize cuneiform characters on your Android phone.
This package contains all the tools necessary to extract grain sizes from images, digitally sieve grain size measurements, and gather descriptive statistics on sieved data.
R package for 3D reconstruction of archaeological excavations.
An R package for processing and analyzing 3D scans of archaeological lithics.
3d models of archaeological ceramics.
3D amphitheatres.

Cherish is a tool that aids archaeologists and designers to represent historical, urban and archaeological structures and sites in 3D by means of image manipulation and sketching. Combine disparate data types such as photographs, illustrations, diagrams, text annotations, point cloud representation, etc, into a comprehensive 3D space, to make 3D sense of the data.
Installer files for Cherish software.
These tools are meant to help you render orthographic views of 3D models for archaeological publication by simplifying, segmenting, cleaning and rendering 3D meshes.
Series of common tols used by most Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) projects, plus some custom programs to help with the workflow from the camera to the output.

A software interface to a set of tools that process your captured image set to produce the final RTI files. The RTIBuilder download includes the Hemispherical Harmonics (HSH) fitter to create .rti files.

Enables you to view and explore Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) files at very high resolution (Polynomial Texture Maps, Hemispherical Harmonics Map, and Multiview RTI). You can view image files stored on your local file system, and remote files through HTTP.
This is a collection of datasets for photogrammetry.
Created for the very-specific purpose of communicating via android with a raspberry pi running a scanner.
Floor plan app using augmented reality.

Experimental mobile app demoing cultural heritage documentation tools in augmented reality. Supports capturing and annotating photos in 3D space. Proof-of-concept features in the app include image anchoring and surface drawing tools.
This is a LibreOffice Calc spreadsheet designed to help you plan an aerial drone mapping survey mission.
Plotting remote sensing data, especially how to go from XYZ data on an irregular grid to an interpolated raster
Shiny app to analyse Al2O3:C measurements
Development version of the R package 'Luminescence'. The R package 'Luminescence' by the R-Luminescence Group provides a collection of various R functions for luminescence dating data analysis.
An R package for chronological Bayesian models integrated for Optically Stimulated OSL, Luminescence Dating
Solving Ordinary Differential Equations to Understand Luminescence
The R package 'RCarb' provides a collection of various R functions to model dose rates in carbonate-rich samples. The package is a translation of the 'MATLAB' program Carb by Roger P. Nathan
R package to simulate a Luminescence Reader
R package for TL dating
Shiny app for TL dating
DRAC is a Dose Rate and Age Calculator which has been designed to calculate environmental dose rates (_) and ages for trapped charge dating applications
graphical interface for DRAC
ylib is a portable library for reading files with x-y data from powder diffraction, spectroscopy, or other experimental methods
R package: wrapper for the C+library xylib
osl_calibration
Dose Rate Estimation from In-Situ Gamma-Ray Spectrometry Measurements for Luminescence Dating
The goal of paleoxrf is to simplify reading data from Acadia's paleoenvironmental X-Ray Fluorescence laboratory
The goal of xrf is to provide tools to read, plot, and interpret X-Ray fluorescence spectra
PyXRF is a python-based sophisticated fluorescence analysis package for fitting and visualizing X-ray fluorescence data
xraylib is a library containing over 40 functions to be used to retrieve data from some of the most respected databases of physical data in the field of X-ray
Data analysis tools for X-Ray, Neutron and Electron sciences
This app will allow you to build & apply calibrations for the Tracer & Artax series of XRF devices
Analytical Dashboard for conducting various analysis to group and assess groupings for Neutron Activation Analytical chemical compositional data
Radiocarbon Dating, Age-Depth Modelling, Relative Sea Level Rate Estimation, and Non-Parametric Phase Modelling
Methods for calibrating and analysing radiocarbon dates
IOSACal is an open source tool for radiocarbon calibration
The goal of carbon14 is to provide a tidy interface to radiocarbon dating, to promote its inclusion in reproducible manuscripts
A python implementation of the method of clustering radiocarbon dates in order to determine whether they represent separate events, or phases in time
Analyse geomagnetic data from archaeological context
RGPR is a free and open-source software package to read, export, analyse, process and visualise ground-penetrating radar (GPR) data
A light-weight database application designed to standardize and simplify data entry of archaeological or historical artifacts
archaeology-object-data-collector-app
Archaeological Information System

The ARK v1.1.2 Stable Release. ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) is a web-based 'toolkit' for the collection, storage and dissemination of archaeological data. It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) 2.0 Development Repository. ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) is a web-based 'toolkit' for the collection, storage and dissemination of archaeological data. It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

This is a Django project to obtain statistical information from an ARK project. It is aimed to mine data from archaeological databases and create customizable visualizations, querying both text and geographical data.
python qgis plugin of recexcavAAR's archprofile
Tasks for Excavations in AutoCAD
Management system for physical storage of archaeological finds
A python plugin for QGIS aimed at managing data from archaeological contexts on the GIS platform
This package simplifies a few workflows when working with multi-proxy paleo-archive data
Tool for assisted geocoding of historical datasets (something between a manual table editing and automated geocoding script)
Open Data Kit forms and conversion scripts used in archaeology. Including New Mexico LA Forms, photologs, etc
E5 is a generalized data entry program intended for archaeologists that works with a configuration file where the data entry fields are defined
Dedalo is a knowledge management system for Cultural Heritage (tangible and intangible), Natural Heritage and Oral History/Memory.

Ishtar is a database project for managing archaeological data and documentation from archaeological operations, that prioritizes maximum traceability of the information. Designed to enable inter-database communication, the Ishtar project aims rather to a distributed information model than a centralized one: communication between the databases is favored.

Stratibase is a minimal field recording database application (currently in FileMaker FP7 format software), aimed at the simplest structure possible to perform the basic functions of a stratigraphic recording.
Fiche Stratigraphique Numerique (FSN) is an application project for field recording and management of archaeological operations data.
A simplified touch optimized interface for QGIS.
A database interface designed to facilitate the irregular, iterative, and non-linear workflows that are commonly employed in lithic analysis.
R package for interacting with the Paleocore API
Datasets used in Binford's 2001 book "Constructing Frames of Reference: An Analytical Method for Archaeological Theory Building Using Ethnographic and Environmental Data Sets
Datasets from studies of cultural evolution in Archaeology
The Database of Obsidian Sourcing Studies
An R package that collects together data for the ancient world
Package for downloading and preparing shkr data for archaeological analysis
The archdata package provides several types of data that are typically used in archaeological research
Experimenting with the opencontext.org API using R
Scrapers for public radiocarbon databases
This contains a set of data about human mobility, subsistance, population, and environmental productivity derived from the Standard Cross Cultural Sample
Map of the Roman Empire made with vector tiles
A dataset and discussion relating to Roman amphitheaters
Roman amphitheater data as R package
These are geojson files relevant to Roman history. Initially they are all derived from the Ancient World Mapping Center's set of CC-BY-NC licensed shapefiles.
This page presents an ever growing collection of resources for digital mapping.
Making the freely available and excellent Orbis data just a little bit more easy to use.
Orbis data as an R package
collection of archaeological data for training purposes.
GeoJSON files for ceramic kilns of the ancient world, no chronological/spatial boundaries
Programmatic R interface to the Neotoma Paleoecological Database
R package to query different openly accessible radiocarbon date databases, allowing for basic data cleaning, calibration and merging
An R package to analyse sedimentary charcoal records from the Global Charcoal Database to reconstruct past biomass burning
Global Charcoal Database
An interactive database of construction materials used in antiquity meant to enable creation of 3D and virtual reality (VR) models of historic structures.
An app to collect data on archaeological objects.
Make a stratigraphic-style plot-schematic of sediment colour using munsell values
This R script produces a exploratory visual for assessing site date ranges originally suggested to me by Wesley Bernardini Redlands University
This R Function creates a simple Ford diagram for archaeological seriation with error bars determined based on sample size were count data are given
Plot data on skeletal templates quickly
Provides easy access to, and manipulation of, the Munsell colours
Colour Schemes for Archaeological Data Visualization
Platform for crowdsourcing the digital recreation of lost heritage
An online space for sharing data, 3d models, etc about archaeological objects to enable the comparison of these objects.
This project represents the current evolution of Open Context. It's intended to be an easier to maintain code-base, and to make the data published by Open Context easier to maintain.
Towards a data standard for paleoanthropology.
Metadata scheme for National Register of Historic Places, transcribed from the National Park Service NPS Bulletin 16
ARCSCore is a metadata standard for organizing and sharing digital versions of non-digital documents created during the course of an archaeological investigation
The ArchVocab ontologies by Leif Isaksen
Roman Peasant Project Small Finds Ontology
Shortcodes to describe inclusions in ceramic bodies.
Poseidon is a framework that seeks to provide standardized ways to store and share archaeogenetic, and perhaps more broadly, molecular archaeological datasets.
Total Open Station downloads and exports survey data from your total station.
Manuals for total stations
Tools to use and manipulate total station data
Faked GIS-Datasets, simulating an island in the Atlantic for educational purposes in using GIS in archaeology
GIS Projects for teaching and learning about Computational Archaeology
An introduction to the issues, methods, and techniques of digital archaeology, integrated with working code and virtual computing environments or 'notebooks' written in Python or R.
A webpage containing brief biographical information about some iconic archaeologists.

item_name: A Mobile Data-Collection Workflow for Archaeologists
description: A list of tools and resource for data collection and processing in the field.
Scientific Computing Environment for archaeology: Installing R, Rstudio and other things on a lightweight Linux in a VirtualBox virtual machine
A LaTeX textbook devoted to explain how archaeologists can work with GRASS GIS
A collection of texts, 3d models, and maybe other resources useful for teaching about the Roman Empire.
A page for video tutorials on R, specifically for archaeology
A tutorial for (archaeological) predictive mapping using r
Documenting and sharing my ad-hoc fieldwork database setup
Information and guidelines for a workshop about managing archaeological databases
A set of best practices, how-tos and implementations for publishing pottery drawings on the Web
Routines to read and analyze LA-ICP-MS data from the Field Museum's Elemental Analysis Facility
How does wikipedia see archaeology?
Using R with wikipedia for various things
A Distant Reading of the Day of Archaeology
export of posts from dayofarchaeology.com
Climate Response and Virginia Archaeology: Maps from Different Points of View
Proof of concept map for disaster response and archaeology
This repo contains the code for an interactive website created to illustrate historical background, findings and data of the Siponto excavation site (Manfredonia, Italy)
A simple adventure game in Unity2D. Revolves around being an archaeologist exploring some ruin and digging up treasure/fossils
Inspired by the research project of historiography of ancient Graeco-Roman religions, the main goal is to spread a selected cult successfully across the ancient Mediterranean

The goal of this project is to spatially locate bibliographic resources regarding the archaeology of Anatolia (modern Turkey). This takes the bibliography of archaeology to the next level by showing not only the topics and authors, but where the archaeological research is being done.
A list of open source archaeological software and resources.
A directory of GitHub projects by OR for archaeologists.
This CRAN Task View contains a list of packages useful for scientific work in Archaeology.
OpenAccessArchaeology.org is dedicated to helping people discover and use Open Access resources in the field of Archaeology.
Keith KintighTools for Quantitative Archaeology TFQA, is a package of more than 45 PC programs developed to satisfy several unusual analytical needs of archaeologists.

item_name: Isaac's List of FOSS tools for academics... and what to use them for!
description: An annotated list of open source tools for academics.
Table of faunal analyses from archaeological sites in the Levant.

item_name: Roundup of Resources on Ancient Geography
description: Included in the following list are links to digital project dealing with geography and the ancient world.

This publication systematically describes ancient-world information resources on the world-wide web. The bibliographic data presented herein has been programmatically extracted from the content of AWOL - The Ancient World Online (ISSN 2156-2253) and formatted in accordance with a structured data model.
A repository listing Museums active on GitHub, written in Rstats.

Open Archaeology hosts a number of sub-projects that while functional at a component level are intended to interoperate creating a complete AIS (Archaeological Information System), including the components necessary to manage the organisation carrying out the archaeology.
Colossal Cave Adventure digital palaeography and epigraphy project.
Sketch of a look at the 'grand challenges' of Kintigh et al. 2014.

This poster presents an approach that helps archaeological projects maintain an authoritative database, while retaining the flexibility and accessibility needed for ongoing research with multiple collaborators, by implementing a server-client architecture to maintain a single, consistent research database.
Extract text from archaeological photos containing a sign board and tag as metadata.
Dashboard showing ceramic EDA and interaction network construction in the Late Prehistoric Central Illinois River Valley.
You have a sequence of numbered items and want to check if any are missing.
A simple algorithm to find local maxima/minima in sequential data.
The mudata2 package provides tools to read, write, and document multi-parameter spatiotemporal data.
The Soil Texture Wizard is a set of R functions designed to produce texture triangles (also called texture plots, texture diagrams, texture ternary plots), classify and transform soil textures data
A set of extra utilities that extend the functionlaity provided by core packages for spatial data management and analysis in R.
A tool for automatically measuring tree-ring width using image processing techniques.
Scripts to create QR-Code images for storage boxes. Each box has an associated web page describing its content, and the QR-Code serves as a short-link from the physical object to the web page.

A collection of functions that built in different points in time. The functions' aim spans from univariate outlier detection, to permutation t test, permutation chi-square test, calculation of Brainerd-Robinson similarity coefficient, validation of logistic regression models, point pattern analysis, and more.
Some scripts that could be useful for QGIS users.
A simple qgis plugin that measures the 3d distance between two selected points.

Excel file containing macro commands making it possible to transform a 1/0 table (presence / absence) into a graphic matrix treated by matrix permutations; it is possible to take into account the uncertain presence of a character. The instructions for use are contained in the file.
Small command line tool for 14C calibration.
Backend for one of the largest 14C-Database online.
Practice some techniques for analysing archaeological radiocabon ages using R.
rintchron provides an R interface to IntChron, an indexing service and exchange format for chronological data such as radiocarbon dates.
R package for the analysis of the fragmentation of archeological objects.
CoproID helps you to identify the "true maker" of Illumina sequenced Coprolites/Paleofaeces by checking the microbiome composition and the endogenous DNA.
An R API client for the Open Context archaeological data repository.
An Archaeology Stop Motion Movie Festival!
Allen's Interval Algebra for Archaeologists.
Photogrammetry tutorial.
Radiocarbon Dating Resolution Calculator.
A benchmark dataset for automated detection of archaeological sites on LiDAR data.
A Collection of R S4 Classes that Represent Archaeological Data.
R package for year-based time scales
Tools for Quantitative Archaeology - in R.
Repository containing lists of all published ancient metagenome samples (and related).

Arches is a web platform for creating, managing, & visualizing geospatial data. Arches was inspired by the needs of the Cultural Heritage community, particularly the widespread need of organizations to build & manage cultural heritage inventories.
A Google Doc with different archaeological and anthropological datasets and resources for students who need to make changes to their project due to COVID-19

Tools to directly model underlying population dynamics using chronological datasets (radiocarbon and other) with a variety of models, including Continuous Piecewise Linear (CPL) model framework, and model comparison framework using BIC. Package also calibrates 14C samples, and generates Summed Probability Distributions (SPD). CPL modelling directly estimates the most likely population trajectory given a dataset, using SPD simulation analysis to generate a Goodness-of-fit test for the best selected model.

item_name: Classical and ancient Linked Open Data
description: A list of linked open data repositories relating to classics and ancient history.
Forms for the Open Data Kit mobile data collection app.
A modular software for display, editing and visualization of 3D-data typically acquired with structured light scanning (SLS) or structure from motion (SfM).
A Data Package specification for archaeological stratigraphy data following the Harris Matrix convention.
Fix the Exif.Image.Artist tag based on user input depending from the camera model. Useful if you have a bunch of photographs from different people all mixed up.

TRiDaS is a universal data exchange standard for the dendrochronology community. This project contains the data standard itself as well as libraries and tools useful for reading, writing and converting dendro data files.
What is the correlation between the exposure time of your photographs and the time of the day?
Manipulate log-ratios (also known as log size index (LSI) values) from measurements obtained on zooarchaeological material.
Set of formal methods for studying archaeological iconographic datasets (rock-art, pottery decoration, stelae, etc.) using network and spatial analysis.

A web-based data management infrastructure that allows researchers to design, create, manage, analyse and publish their own richly-structured database(s) through a simple web interface, without the need for programmers or consultants.
An R package for Smith's Mean Measure of Divergence (MMD), with a graphical user interface, facilities for trait selection and graphical representations.
An R package to facilitate the use of Murail et al.’s (1999) approach of sex estimation in past populations.
3D reconstruction of incomplete archaeological objects using a generative adversarial network (GAN).
Known pyramids of Ancient Egypt using python + OpenStreetMap.
Detect and Parse Historic Dates in R.
An online tool for the comparative analysis of museum databases.
A mobile application for the intuitive recording of human bones from archaeological sites.
Tool for the automatic recognition of archaeological pottery.
Multilingual glossary designed to enhance access to archaeological data.
R package for tidy radiocarbon data.
Piwigo plugin for viewing 3D models using 3DHOP.
R interface for open paleoclimate data.
Ancient animal occurrence data from Uerpmann 1987, *The Ancient Distribution of Ungulate Mammals in the Middle East*, TAVO A27.
Bayesian tools for reconstructing past demography.
Allen relations from Bayesian calibration: R function to compare two indefinite intervals produced by a Bayesian calibration using the Allen algebra.
A collection of functions that can be used to execute OxCal from within R.
An Approximate Bayesian Computation Framework for inferring patterns of cultural transmission from frequency data.
A visualization tool for paleoclimatic modeling data.

The nimbleCarbon package provides utility functions and bespoke probability distributions for the Bayesian analyses of radiocarbon dates using the NIMBLE framework. The package is particularly dedicated to demographic inferences based on changing frequencies of radiocarbon dates.
R Shiny Document - Visualizing model functions in Neimans 'Stylistic variation in evolutionary perspective' with an interactive document.
An R package for data reduction, visualization and analysis in skyscape archaeology, archaeoastronomy and cultural astronomy.

An R implementation of the Fast Marching Method (FMM), first developed by Sethian (1996), with the modifications of Silva and Steele (2012, 2014). Also included is a spatial wrapper function that makes it easier to model dispersal scenarios in geospatial domains, as originally envisaged for the study and simulation of prehistoric dispersals
Code repository of the book by Oliver Nakoinz and Daniel Knitter "Modelling Human Behaviour in Landscapes -- Basic concepts and modelling elements".

The Archive des datations radiocarbones d'Afrique centrale (archive for radiocarbon datings from Central Africa, aDRAC) provides a catalogue of available radiocarbon dates from Central Africa. The data cover published radiocarbon dates and essential metadata for each date as well as available references.

R package that provides the infrastructure for ordering objects with an implementation of several seriation/sequencing/ordination techniques to reorder matrices, dissimilarity matrices, and dendrograms (see below for a full list). Also provides (optimally) reordered heatmaps, color images and clustering visualizations like dissimilarity plots, and visual assessment of cluster tendency plots (VAT and iVAT).
author5_name: Michael Brusco, Stephanie Stahl, and Hans-Friedrich Koehn

description: A collection of time-stratigraphic publications.

An R package that provides functions for 3D tessellation with Voro++ and subsequent horizontal cutting of the resulting polygons for 2D plotting. It was developed for archaeological spatiotemporal data, but may as well be used for other three dimensional contexts.
CalPal 14C-Database created by Bernhard Weninger (Universität zu Köln) as part of the CalPal software package. This repository serves as an interface to access the data more easily.
Shiny app to search and filter radiocarbon dates from various source databases, based on the R package c14bazAAR.
The goal of idaifieldR is to flexibly get data from the idaifield database into R.

The German Archaeological Institute’s (DAI) new take on a field research documentation system. Combining features of GIS, photo management, and database management systems in a unique and integrating manner, it aims at facilitating archaeological workflows by reducing the overhead of using multiple systems. Developed in-house by the DAI’s information technology department, it targets primarily the needs of the institute’s excavations, older ones as well as those to come. Yet, due to the nature of its adjustable data model and the fact it is open source software, any interested third party is free to reuse and adjust it to their needs.

Converting date ranges into dating 'steps' eases the visualization of changes in e.g. pottery consumption, style and other variables over time. This package provides tools to process and prepare data for visualization.
R package for aoristic analysis; the goal of aoristic is to make sense of temporally vague data.
A simple app for tracing outlines of an irregular shape and exporting the coordinates of the outline.
An R package to derive outline shapes from (multiple) artefacts on JPEG images.
An open source, web application for the presentation of archaeological data especially for burial studies.
A collection of archaeological datasets and tools related to the prehistory of Southwest Asia.
Pipeline for metagenomic identification and authentication of ancient dietary DNA from archaeological samples.
List of all past and present radiocarbon laboratory codes known to have been used in published references.
A repository of radiocarbon data for Rapa Nui.

An integrated framework that allows scientists to generate state-of-the-art age models for their records, create time-uncertain ensembles of their data, analyze those ensembles with a number of commonly-used techniques, and visualize their results in an intuitive way.
A set of programs aimed at simulating ancient DNA fragments. For ancient hominin samples our program can also simulate various levels of present-day human contamination and microbial contamination.
An open call to edit and revise current typological assignments and attributes associated with diagnostic artifacts found across the National Forests and Grasslands in Texas (NFGT).
Peer reviewed and indexed articles published on Caddo archaeology since 2000.
Algorithms, implementations, manuscripts, and test cases for iterative deterministic frequency seriation done by agglomeration.
An open source, web based database system for complex archaeological, historical and geospatial data.
R package to compute dissimilarity between multivariate time series.
Estimation of human stature from long bone measurements according to several well established estimation formula.
Python implementation of postAAR.
An automated process to detect buildings within large sets of postholes in multi-occupational sites, similar to the obsolete Windows-software "posthole" by Irwin Scollar.
Exchange data format (XML) for NoNeK (Nordmitteleuropäische Neolithische Keramik).

Tool for calculating the largest empty circles and estimation of archaeological sites theoretically to be expected in region of interest, an implementation of the method published by Andreas Zimmermann and Karl Peter Wendt (2003).

Simple Principal Components Analysis (PCA) and Correspondence Analysis (CA) based on the Singular Value Decomposition (SVD). This package provides S4 classes and methods to compute, extract, summarize and visualize results of multivariate data analysis. It also includes methods for partial bootstrap validation.

Datasets for teaching quantitative approaches and modeling in archaeology and paleontology. This package provides several types of data related to broad topics (cultural evolution, radiocarbon dating, paleoenvironments, etc.), which can be used to illustrate statistical methods in the classroom (multivariate data analysis, compositional data analysis, diversity measurement, etc.).
yada, which stands for Yet Another Demographic Analysis package, supports a variety of demographic tasks, with most applications drawn from forensic anthroplogy and archaeology.
